attributes.comment:
"My initial take on the proposed immigration fee increase was the sentiment that
likes any other service in the public domain the costs for such services are
subject to change given the prevailing socio-economic situation. Upon further
reflection, I was however driven to question the legitimacy and true motive for the
enormous pending fee hikes. The reasons cited for the increase raise are evidently
inadequate at the moment and necessitate careful review and justification.
Arguably, the post 9-11 era has definitely changed the landscape for America,
particularly in the areas of immigration and homeland security. Notwithstanding,
financing the cost of these two crucial branches of the federal government should
not be left to the mercies of lawful and would be residents of the US. Least it
should be forgotten that the very fabric of the US was built by immigrants who
today have coined the term "resident aliens" to their likes. Meanwhile, the agency
boasts that almost 99% of its funding is derived from fees levied on those
benefiting from the services. If the objective is to make the agency self-reliant,
then all US residents ought to foot the bill. Immigration and homeland security are
the heart of America's welfare and should therefore have the full budgetary support
from the government. This is in no way intended to say that those who benefit
directly from the services should not pay accordingly but that such flagrant
imposition on those who are lawfully seeking the "American Dream" should not be
the approach as this may very likely lead to more divisive means to the end?..
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Martha Charles-Glenn
